item.title: Instacart 推出白标人工智能购物聊天机器人，推动企业发展
item.description: Instacart 正在为杂货店增加人工智能工具，包括一个可以进行产品推荐的助手，这是向零售商销售企业软件的最新努力。【原文：Instacart is adding artificial intelligence-powered tools for grocers, including an assistant that can make product recommendations, the latest in a growing effort to sell enterprise software to retailers.】

item.title: 巴西财政部长称是时候放宽 15%的利率了
item.description: 巴西财政部长表示，巴西央行在抗击通胀的过程中使用了过猛的严厉货币政策，损害了经济，阻碍了政府限制公共债务的计划。【原文：Brazil’s central bank is applying too strong a dose of tough monetary medicine in its fight against inflation, hurting the economy and hampering government plans to limit public debt, according to the country’s finance chief.】

item.title: 中国启动进口促进措施以解决失衡问题
item.description: 中国公布了一项促进从其他国家进口的新计划，因为中国政府正试图减轻贸易伙伴对中国商品充斥其市场并挤占当地产业的担忧。【原文：China unveiled a new program to boost imports from other countries, as Beijing seeks to mitigate trading partners’ concerns over the nation’s goods flooding their market and crowding out local industries.】

item.title: Ares 高管表示，欧洲接下来将出现巨额私人信贷交易
item.description: 私人信贷领域最大的参与者之一预计，规模越来越大的交易趋势将跨越大西洋转移到欧洲。【原文：One of the largest players in private credit expects the trend of ever bigger deals to move across the Atlantic to Europe.】

item.title: 外汇交易老兵寻求以华尔街的形象重建加密货币体系
item.description: 一群前外汇专业人士正试图将华尔街的市场结构引入自由的加密世界。【原文：A group of former foreign-exchange professionals is trying to import Wall Street’s market structure into the freewheeling world of crypto.】

item.title: 美国制裁开始生效，俄罗斯原油交付量骤降
item.description:
自九月初以来，油轮上的俄罗斯石油数量增加了 8%

。【原文：

The amount of Russian oil held on tankers has risen by 8% since the start of September

】

item.title: 卡尼寻求经济增长，加拿大将启动 360 亿美元建设基金
item.description: 加拿大将启动一项500亿加元（约合355亿美元）的基础设施基金，用于建设医院、交通和住房等领域的项目，因为政府正试图提振受到美国关税挤压的经济。【原文：Canada is set to launch a C$50 billion ($35.5 billion) infrastructure fund to build projects in sectors such as hospitals, transportation and housing, as the government tries to boost an economy that’s being squeezed by US tariffs.】

item.title: 研究：汽车贷款欺诈造成的损失飙升，超过其他债务
item.description: 根据征信机构全美征信公司（TransUnion）最近的一项分析，汽车贷款的损失要 "大大高于 "其他类型的消费信贷产品。【原文：When auto loans suffer losses they are “dramatically higher” than losses in other types of consumer credit products, according to a recent analysis by the credit bureau TransUnion.】

item.title: 拉脱维亚竞逐东欧首个欧洲央行董事会席位
item.description: 拉脱维亚将争夺欧洲中央银行执行董事会的席位，力争成为第一个加入该机构最高领导层的东欧国家。【原文：Latvia will fight for a seat on the European Central Bank’s Executive Board, bidding to become the first eastern European country to join the institution’s top leadership.】

item.title: AMD 自 2001 年以来业绩最好的一个月为盈利带来了 "炫耀 "压力
item.description: 先进微设备公司（Advanced Micro Devices Inc.这一过程将从周二收盘后的财报开始。【原文：After its best month in the stock market in almost 25 years, Advanced Micro Devices Inc. needs to show that it truly is a major beneficiary of the artificial intelligence spending boom. That process begins with its earnings after the bell on Tuesday.】

item.title: 鲍曼称巴塞尔协议是当务之急，但不能真空看待资本问题
item.description: 美联储最高级别的银行警察表示，公布与《巴塞尔协议 III》相关的计划是当务之急，但强调新提案必须符合更广泛的银行资本规则框架。【原文：The Federal Reserve’s top bank cop said that unveiling plans tied to Basel III are a priority but emphasized the new proposal must fit into the broader framework of capital rules for banks.】

item.title: Shopify 营收超出分析师预期，股价下跌
item.description: Shopify 公司公布的第三季度营收为 28.4 亿美元，超过了分析师的平均预期，并对今年下半年做出了强劲的展望。【原文：Shopify Inc. reported $2.84 billion in revenue for the third quarter, beating the average analyst estimate, and gave a strong outlook for the rest of the year.】

item.title: 石油供应过剩帮助印度炼油商转向俄罗斯原油
item.description: 加工商将不得不为其原料支付更高的价格，但全球供应过剩应该会提供大量的选择。【原文：Processors will have to pay more for their feedstock, but a global oversupply should provide plenty of options.】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德公司在秘鲁的败诉影响了工人的养老金储蓄
item.description: 在经营秘鲁两条最繁忙收费公路的布鲁克菲尔德资产管理公司（Brookfield Asset Management）子公司宣布解散后，秘鲁养老基金正遭受重创。【原文：Peruvian pension funds are taking a hit in the wake of the announced dissolution of a Brookfield Asset Management subsidiary that operates the country’s two busiest toll roads.】

item.title: 小米的电动汽车赌局包括沉重的人力成本
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，高渊将探讨中国拼命工作文化的不良影响。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Gao Yuan addresses the ill effects of China’s hard-driving work culture.】

item.title: 黑客以货运公司为目标，增加成本并造成混乱
item.description: 高科技货物盗窃是扰乱供应链和提高成本的最新趋势【原文：The latest trend disrupting supply chains and raising costs is high-tech cargo theft】

item.title: 中国再次提出货币国际化目标
item.description: 中国希望通过强势货币巩固其国际影响力【原文：China wants a strong currency to solidify its international influence】

item.title: 伯利在发出泡沫警告后披露了英伟达和帕兰蒂尔的看跌期权
item.description: 迈克尔-伯里（Michael Burry）的 Scion Asset Management 公司披露了对英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）和帕兰提尔科技公司（Palantir Technologies Inc.【原文：Michael Burry’s Scion Asset Management disclosed bearish wagers on Nvidia Corp. and Palantir Technologies Inc. just days after the hedge fund manager posted a cryptic warning to retail investors about market exuberance.】

item.title: 三巨头失势，华尔街后起之秀撼动 ETF 世界
item.description: 索菲亚-马西（Sofia Massie）今年 1 月离开了简街公司（Jane Street）的工作岗位，当时她只有一个想法：建立一个 ETF 基金，以美国股市为蓝本，但悄悄持有股息，从而获得许多投资者从未见过的税收优势。【原文：Sofia Massie left her job at Jane Street in January with one thing: an idea for an ETF that would mirror the US stock market but quietly hold onto dividends, wringing out a tax advantage many investors never see.】

item.title: 核电初创公司计划在印第安纳州建造一座利用自身废料发电的核电站
item.description: 裂变初创企业 First American Nuclear Co. 公司正在开发一座发电厂，首先使用天然气，然后转用反应堆，预计该反应堆将使用从自身核废料中产生的燃料。【原文：Fission startup First American Nuclear Co. is developing a power plant, first using natural gas and then shifting to a reactor expected to run on fuel produced from its own nuclear waste.】

item.title: Uber 在共享单车和外卖出行量激增的情况下仍未实现盈利
item.description: 优步科技公司股价下跌，此前该公司公布的第三季度营业收入不及预期，且发布的当期调整后盈利预期也低于分析师预期。【原文：Uber Technologies Inc. shares fell after the company posted a miss on third-quarter operating income and issued an adjusted earnings forecast for the current period that also fell short of analysts’ estimates.】

item.title: 阿波罗盈利超出预期，资产接近 1 万亿美元
item.description: 阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management Inc.【原文：Apollo Global Management Inc.’s third-quarter earnings surpassed Wall Street estimates as the buyout giant edged closer to reaching $1 trillion of assets.】

item.title: 泰国承诺不开赌场后中国游客回流
item.description: 在泰国，吸引中国游客回流的道路现在是通过道德承诺来实现的：保持赌博的非法性并赢得中国政府的青睐。【原文：In Thailand, the road to luring back Chinese tourists now runs through a moral pledge: keep gambling illegal and win Beijing’s favor.】

item.title: 投资者对股票可能下跌的观点感到恐惧
item.description:
华尔街首席执行官们的警告是在从四月低点急速反弹之后发出的。【原文：

Wall Street CEOs’ warnings come after a blistering rally from April lows.

】

item.title: 为什么 "实物偿付 "债务如此吸引人？
item.description: 当私募股权公司收购目标公司时，他们依靠的主要资金来源是债务，而且是大量的债务。但当债务利息飙升时，会发生什么呢？对某些人来说，答案很简单：以后再还。【原文：When private equity firms buy up target companies, they rely on one major source of financial firepower — debt, and lots of it. But what happens when the interest on that debt jumps? For some, the answer is simple: Pay it later.】

item.title: Nvidia 与德国电信将在德国建造价值 10 亿欧元的数据中心
item.description: 英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）和德国电信公司（Deutsche Telekom AG）正在德国建设一个10亿欧元（12亿美元）的数据中心，以加强欧洲的基础设施，为复杂的人工智能系统提供动力。【原文：Nvidia Corp. and Deutsche Telekom AG are building a €1 billion ($1.2 billion) data center in Germany to bolster infrastructure in Europe that can power complex artificial intelligence systems.】

item.title: 首席执行官交接在即，Spotify 用户数超预期
item.description: Spotify Technology SA 第三季度的月活跃用户同比增长 11%，达到 7.13 亿人，超过分析师预计的 7.11 亿人。【原文：Spotify Technology SA’s monthly active users climbed 11% year over year to 713 million in the third quarter, exceeding analysts’ estimates of 711 million.】

item.title: 华尔街的人工智能能源议程渗入全球气候谈判
item.description: 再过几天，金融业对气候变化的态度将发生根本性的改变。【原文：In a few days, the finance industry’s fundamentally altered approach to climate change will be on full display.】

item.title: 华尔街痴迷于大型科技公司，没有广度就没有问题
item.description: 美国股市在人工智能的推动下不断上涨，市场为之着迷，但华尔街似乎很少有人在意，只有少数几家公司在领跑。【原文：In a market captivated by the relentless AI-powered rally in US equities, few on Wall Street seem to mind that only a handful of companies are leading the charge.】

item.title: 中国抨击荷兰在 Nexperia 芯片对峙中采取强硬立场
item.description: 中国批评荷兰政府没有采取足够的措施来解决与芯片制造商 Nexperia 的争端，这一争端已演变成汽车行业的供应紧张。【原文：China criticized the Dutch government for not taking enough steps to resolve a dispute over chipmaker Nexperia, which has spiraled into a supply crunch for the auto industry.】
